    • Constructor Detail

      • ModelTrainer

        public ModelTrainer(String trainingCsvPath)
        Simplified Constructor equivalent to calling ModelTrainer(rainingCsvPath, 10000, 80)

      • ModelTrainer

        public ModelTrainer(String trainingCsvPath,
            int numIterations,
            int numTopics)
        Basic Constructor
        Parameters:
        trainingCsvPath - path for training instances which format is described in attached readme
        numIterations - how many iterations perform while learning model (10000 is almost for sure O.K)
        numTopics - number of internal topics ( abstract topics NOT the categories - in other words number of dimensions we want to reduce ours space to ). Setting this number to number of categories is usual strategy.

    • Method Detail

      • readModelFromFile

        public void readModelFromFile(String pathname)
                       throws Exception
        This method is reading model from 3 files which prefixes are described by pathname. pathname +"model.lda" is path for trained model pathname +"trainignInstaces.lda" is path for training instances in binary format pathname + "docPerTopic.lda" is path for model for for KNN like second model for more information about how these are used please consult readme attached
        Specified by:
        readModelFromFile in class AbstractModelTrainer
        Parameters:
        pathname - path defining location of model
        Throws:
        Exception

      • saveModel

        public void saveModel(String pathname)
        This method is saving model to 3 files which prefixes are described by pathname. pathname +"model.lda" is path for trained model pathname +"trainignInstaces.lda" is path for training instances in binary format pathname + "docPerTopic.lda" is path for model for for KNN like second model for more information about how these are used please consult readme attached
        Specified by:
        saveModel in class AbstractModelTrainer
        Parameters:
        pathname - path definig location of model

      • trainModel

        public void trainModel()
                throws IOException,
                       UnsupportedEncodingException
        Description copied from class: AbstractModelTrainer
        This method simply trains model. Firstly the constructor should be called or model should be read from file by readModelFromFile method
        Specified by:
